entries: Quando si riduce una creatura ostile a 0 punti ferita o si ottiene un colpo critico con un attacco con armi da mischia nel proprio turno, si può spendere un dado battaglia per muoversi fino a 15 piedi ed effettuare un attacco aggiuntivo con armi da mischia. Il dado battaglia viene aggiunto al tiro per i danni dell'attacco.

optionalfeature.name: Heelcutter
entries: Quando si effettua un attacco di opportunità contro una creatura, si può spendere un dado battaglia per sbilanciare la creatura, impedendole di fuggire. Si aggiunge il dado battaglia al tiro di attacco e il bersaglio deve effettuare un tiro salvezza di Forza. Se il tiro salvezza fallisce, la sua velocità viene ridotta a 0 fino alla fine del suo turno.

optionalfeature.name: Reckless Assault
entries: Quando si effettua un attacco contro una creatura, si può spendere un dado battaglia per sferrare un attacco disperato e selvaggio, lasciandosi vulnerare. Si ha vantaggio nel tiro per colpire. Fino all'inizio del proprio turno successivo, tuttavia, i tiri di attacco contro di sé hanno vantaggio.

optionalfeature.name: Staggering Strike
entries: Come azione bonus quando si effettua un attacco con armi contro una creatura, si può spendere un dado di battaglia per tentare di stordire un bersaglio umanoide. Se viene colpito, il bersaglio deve effettuare un tiro salvezza di Costituzione o subire {@condition incapacitated} fino all'inizio del vostro prossimo turno.

optionalfeature.name: Acid Bomb
entries: Mescolando il contenuto esplosivo della bomba con alcune gocce di acido ardenflotico, una sostanza chimica altamente corrosiva, è possibile trasformarla in una bomba acida. Una bomba acida infligge danni da acido invece che da fuoco e ha {@dice d4} dadi danno. Inoltre, il bersaglio, così come ogni creatura nel raggio dell'esplosione che fallisce il tiro salvezza, subisce di nuovo la stessa quantità di danni alla fine del suo turno.

optionalfeature.name: Arcano Bomb
entries: Aggiungendo una dinamo non utilizzata alla bomba (e quindi spendendo lo slot incantesimi della dinamo), è possibile trasformarla in una bomba arcano. Una bomba arcano infligge danni da forza anziché da fuoco, i suoi dadi danno sono {@dice d12}s e infligge un dado danno extra, come se vi fosse aggiunto un dado reagente.

optionalfeature.name: Black Powder Bomb
entries: Sostituendo il reagente esplosivo della bomba con una carica di polvere nera, è possibile trasformarla in una bomba a polvere nera. Una bomba a polvere nera ha {@dice d12} dadi danno.

optionalfeature.name: Bramble Bomb
entries: Aggiungendo un potente fertilizzante al contenuto esplosivo della bomba, è possibile trasformarla in una bomba di rovi. Una bomba di rovi non infligge danni, ma fa spuntare rovi duri e spinosi da qualsiasi area di terreno naturale nel raggio di esplosione della bomba, che diventa un terreno difficile. Inoltre, se una creatura nel raggio dell'esplosione è prona quando la bomba esplode, viene avvolta dai rovi e deve effettuare una prova di Forza ({@skill Athletics}) contrastata dalla DC di salvezza della bomba per muoversi o alzarsi. I rovi si avvizziscono e muoiono dopo 1 minuto.

optionalfeature.name: Cryo Bomb
entries: Sostituendo il reagente esplosivo della bomba con un pezzo di ghiaccio nove, è possibile trasformarla in una bomba crio. Una bomba crio infligge danni da freddo invece che da fuoco, ha {@dice d8} dadi danno e richiede un tiro salvezza di Costituzione invece che di Destrezza. Inoltre, il bersaglio, così come ogni creatura nel raggio dell'esplosione che fallisce il tiro salvezza, ha una velocità ridotta di 3 metri fino alla fine del suo turno successivo.

optionalfeature.name: Holy Bomb
entries: Aggiungendo alcune gocce di acqua santa al contenuto esplosivo della bomba, è possibile trasformarla in una bomba sacra. Una bomba sacra infligge danni radianti invece di quelli da fuoco e ha {@dice d8} dadi danno, a meno che il bersaglio non sia un celestiale, un demone o un non morto. I dadi danno della bomba sono {@dice d6}s contro i celestiali e {@dice d12}s contro i demoni e i non morti.

optionalfeature.name: Impact Bomb
entries: Sostituendo il reagente esplosivo della bomba con uno più reattivo, è possibile trasformarla in una bomba a impatto. Una bomba a impatto infligge danni da forza invece che da fuoco e ha {@dice d8} dadi danno. Inoltre, il bersaglio e ogni creatura nel raggio dell'esplosione che fallisce il tiro salvezza vengono spinti a un metro e mezzo di distanza dal centro dell'esplosione.

optionalfeature.name: Incendiary Bomb
entries: Aggiungendo un agente addensante al contenuto esplosivo della bomba, è possibile trasformarla in una bomba incendiaria. Una bomba incendiaria ha {@dice d6} dadi danno. Inoltre, l'area del raggio dell'esplosione viene avvolta dalle fiamme che persistono fino all'inizio del turno successivo. Gli oggetti infiammabili che si trovano in quest'area e che non sono indossati o trasportati prendono fuoco. Ogni creatura che termina il proprio turno in quest'area subisce metà dei danni della bomba.

optionalfeature.name: Laughing Gas Bomb
entries: Mescolando il contenuto esplosivo della bomba con una goccia di jesterate, una sostanza chimica altamente euforizzante, è possibile trasformarla in una bomba di gas esilarante. Una bomba di gas esilarante infligge danni da veleno invece che da fuoco, ha {@dice d6} dadi danno e richiede un tiro salvezza di Costituzione invece che di Destrezza. Inoltre, il bersaglio e ogni creatura nel raggio dell'esplosione che fallisce il tiro salvezza cade {@condition prone} in una crisi di risa. Una volta che una creatura viene bersagliata da questa bomba o riesce in un tiro salvezza contro di essa, non cade {@condition prone} nei successivi tiri salvezza falliti.

optionalfeature.name: Lightning Bomb
entries: Sostituendo il reagente esplosivo della bomba con un condensatore arcano carico, è possibile trasformarla in una bomba lampo. Una bomba fulminea infligge danni da fulmine invece che da fuoco e ha {@dice d8} dadi danno. Inoltre, il bersaglio, così come ogni creatura nel raggio dell'esplosione che fallisce il tiro salvezza, non può prendere reazioni fino alla fine del suo turno successivo.

optionalfeature.name: Nonlethal Bomb
entries: Sostituendo il reagente esplosivo della bomba con un sacchetto di pallini di gomma, è possibile trasformarla in una bomba non letale. Una bomba non letale infligge danni da percosse invece che da fuoco e ha {@dice d8} dadi danno. Se il danno di questa bomba fa scendere una creatura a 0 punti ferita, la stordisce invece di infliggere un colpo mortale, rendendo la creatura {@condition unconscious} e stabile. Inoltre, i proiettili di gomma di questa bomba rimbalzano attorno agli angoli, ignorando le coperture di metà e tre quarti dei bersagli nel raggio dell'esplosione.

optionalfeature.name: Oil Bomb
entries: Mescolando il contenuto esplosivo della bomba con alcune gocce di un super-surfattante, è possibile trasformarla in una bomba a olio. Una bomba a olio non infligge danni, ma ricopre ogni creatura nel raggio dell'esplosione con un olio appiccicoso e infiammabile. La prossima volta che una creatura ricoperta di olio subisce danni da fuoco, subisce un ulteriore d6 danni per ogni dado di danno da fuoco tirato, fino a un massimo di metà del proprio livello di alchimista, arrotondato per eccesso. L'olio può essere rimosso inzuppando la creatura con un litro d'acqua.

optionalfeature.name: Painkiller Bomb
entries: Mescolando il reagente esplosivo della propria bomba con un impasto di olio analgesico, è possibile trasformarla in una bomba antidolorifica. Una bomba antidolorifica non infligge danni, ma concede a ogni creatura nel suo raggio d'azione punti ferita temporanei pari a {@dice 1d8} più metà del proprio livello di alchimista, che durano fino alla fine del turno successivo. Questa bomba non ha effetto su costrutti e non morti.

optionalfeature.name: Pheromone Bomb
entries: Sostituendo il reagente esplosivo della bomba con un potente feromone, è possibile trasformarla in una bomba a feromoni. Una bomba a feromoni richiede un tiro salvezza di Saggezza invece che di Destrezza. La bomba non infligge danni, ma fa sì che il bersaglio, così come ogni creatura nel raggio dell'esplosione che fallisce il tiro salvezza, sia {@condition charmed} da voi fino alla fine del suo turno o subisca danni.

optionalfeature.name: Psionic Bomb
entries: Mescolando il contenuto esplosivo della bomba con la polvere di un cristallo psionico, è possibile trasformarla in una bomba psionica. Una bomba psionica infligge danni psichici anziché da fuoco, i suoi dadi danno sono dadi e richiede un tiro salvezza di Saggezza anziché di Destrezza. Inoltre, il bersaglio, così come ogni creatura nel raggio dell'esplosione che fallisce il tiro salvezza, ha svantaggio sui tiri salvezza di Costituzione che effettua per mantenere la concentrazione sugli incantesimi fino alla fine del suo turno successivo, anche contro i danni di questa bomba.

optionalfeature.name: Quiet Bomb
entries: Sostituendo il reagente esplosivo della bomba con un batuffolo di cotone termico, è possibile trasformarla in una bomba silenziosa. Una bomba silenziosa ha {@dice d8} dadi danno. Quando questa bomba esplode, emette solo un basso tonfo, udibile fino a 3 metri, e rilascia uno sbuffo di fumo per mascherare la luce emessa dalla sua esplosione. Le creature hanno svantaggio sulle prove di abilità per rilevare che questa bomba è stata fatta esplodere nelle vicinanze.

optionalfeature.name: Seeking Bomb
entries: Sostituendo il reagente esplosivo della propria bomba con una potente pietra preziosa, è possibile trasformarla in una bomba a ricerca. Una bomba a ricerca ha {@dice d6} dadi danno. Non si subisce svantaggio nell'effettuare un attacco a distanza con questa bomba quando si è entro un raggio di 2 metri da una creatura ostile.

optionalfeature.name: Shrapnel Bomb
entries: Aumentando il reagente esplosivo della propria bomba con cuscinetti metallici, è possibile trasformarla in una bomba a schegge. Una bomba a schegge infligge danni da perforazione invece che da fuoco, ha {@dice d8} dadi danno ed esplode in un raggio di 3 metri.

optionalfeature.name: Slime Bomb
entries: Mescolando il contenuto esplosivo della bomba con i resti di una melma, è possibile trasformarla in una bomba di melma. Una bomba di melma non infligge danni, ma ricopre ogni creatura nel raggio dell'esplosione con una melma verde e viscosa. Nessuna creatura ricoperta di melma può compiere l'azione {@action Dash} o l'azione {@action Disengage}. La melma può essere rimossa inzuppando la creatura con un litro d'acqua o compiendo un'azione per rimuoverne la maggior parte.

optionalfeature.name: Smoke Bomb
entries: Rimuovendo completamente il reagente esplosivo della bomba, è possibile trasformarla in una bomba fumogena. Una bomba fumogena non infligge danni, ma riempie di fumo una sfera del raggio di 3 metri. Questa nebbia si diffonde negli angoli e la sua area è fortemente oscurata. Dura per un numero di round pari al modificatore di Intelligenza o finché un vento di velocità moderata o superiore (almeno 10 miglia orarie) non la disperde. Una volta lanciata una di queste bombe, non è possibile lanciarne un'altra per 1 minuto.

optionalfeature.name: Sonic Bomb
entries: Mescolando il contenuto esplosivo della bomba con alcune gocce di essenza elementale dell'aria, è possibile trasformarla in una bomba sonica. Una bomba sonica infligge danni da tuono invece che da fuoco, ha {@dice d6} dadi danno e richiede un tiro salvezza di Costituzione invece che di Destrezza. Inoltre, il bersaglio e ogni creatura nel raggio dell'esplosione che fallisce il tiro salvezza subiscono {@condition deafened} fino alla fine del loro turno successivo.

optionalfeature.name: Stink Bomb
entries: Aggiungendo una singola goccia di skunkanide, una sostanza chimica troppo empia per essere descritta, è possibile trasformarla in una bomba puzzolente. Una bomba puzzolente infligge danni da veleno invece che da fuoco, ha {@dice d8} dadi danno e richiede un tiro salvezza di Costituzione invece che di Destrezza. Inoltre, il bersaglio, così come ogni creatura nel raggio dell'esplosione che fallisce il tiro salvezza, ha svantaggio nelle prove di abilità che effettua prima della fine del suo turno successivo.

optionalfeature.name: Teleportation Bomb
entries: Sostituendo il contenuto esplosivo della bomba con un cristallo di etherite incandescente, è possibile trasformarla in una bomba da teletrasporto. Una bomba di teletrasporto non infligge danni e apre una fessura nello spazio, teletrasportandovi istantaneamente nel punto di detonazione. Questo effetto fallisce se la bomba esplode a più di 9 metri di distanza da voi.

optionalfeature.name: Thermobaric Bomb
entries: Sostituendo il reagente esplosivo della bomba con un esplosivo ritardato, è possibile trasformarla in una bomba termobarica. Una bomba termobarica infligge {@dice d6} dadi danno ed esplode in una sfera di 3 metri di raggio.

optionalfeature.name: Venom Bomb
entries: Mescolando alcune gocce di una tossina ad azione rapida ai componenti esplosivi della bomba, è possibile trasformarla in una bomba al veleno. Una bomba al veleno infligge danni da veleno invece che da fuoco, ha {@dice d8} dadi danno e richiede un tiro salvezza di Costituzione invece che di Destrezza. Inoltre, il bersaglio, così come ogni creatura nel raggio dell'esplosione che fallisce il tiro salvezza, ha svantaggio al prossimo tiro salvezza di Forza, Destrezza o Costituzione che effettua prima della fine del suo turno successivo.

optionalfeature.name: Withering Bomb
entries: Mescolando i componenti esplosivi della bomba con un potente agente essiccante, è possibile trasformarla in una bomba appassita. Una bomba appassita infligge danni necrotici anziché da fuoco, ha {@dice d8} dadi danno e richiede un tiro salvezza di Costituzione anziché di Destrezza. Inoltre, il bersaglio, così come ogni creatura nel raggio dell'esplosione che fallisce il tiro salvezza, non può recuperare punti ferita fino alla fine del suo turno successivo.

optionalfeature.name: Prismatic Bomb
entries: Aggiungendo un grammo di polisucco, una sostanza chimica imprevedibile e multicolore, al contenuto esplosivo della bomba, è possibile trasformarla in una bomba prismatica. Una bomba prismatica infligge danni determinati a caso anziché danni da fuoco, ha dadi danno {@dice d8} e richiede un tiro salvezza determinato a caso. Tirare su ciascuna delle seguenti tabelle.

optionalfeature.name: Advanced Poisoner
entries: La tua morbosa ricerca sui veleni più feroci ed esotici ha rivelato come sintetizzare i seguenti veleni quando prepari le pozioni:

optionalfeature.name: Alchemy of Ascendancy
entries: Una svolta nei tuoi studi alchemici ha rivelato la formulazione di diversi potenti elisir. Potete preparare le seguenti pozioni:

optionalfeature.name: Alchemy of Influence
entries: La tua ricerca alchemica ha rivelato molte delle sostanze chimiche di base che regolano le emozioni. Puoi preparare le seguenti pozioni:

optionalfeature.name: Alchemy of Transformation
entries: Hai imparato i segreti alchemici del cambiamento di materia, che ti permettono di preparare le seguenti pozioni:

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Study
entries: Impari tre incantesimi a tua scelta dal {@filter wizard spell list|spells|class=wizard|level=cantrip}. Il modificatore di lancio per questi incantesimi è Intelligenza.

optionalfeature.name: Ballistics Research
entries: Si imparano due formule bomba aggiuntive.

optionalfeature.name: Battle Training
entries: Si acquisisce competenza con le armi marziali e gli scudi.

optionalfeature.name: Beguiling Haze
entries: Quando si incanta una creatura, si può scegliere di metterla in uno stato di sogno, dal quale considera tutti quelli che vede come amici intimi. Mentre la creatura è {@condition charmed}, non è ostile e si comporta come se fosse incantata allo stesso modo da ogni creatura che vede. Una volta utilizzata questa capacità, non è possibile utilizzarla di nuovo fino al termine di un riposo breve o lungo.

optionalfeature.name: Buffered Metabolism
entries: Come reazione, quando si subisce un danno, si può spendere un numero qualsiasi di dadi reagente fino al proprio bonus di competenza per ridurre l'ammontare dei danni subiti fino al totale dei dadi.

optionalfeature.name: Clotting Agent
entries: Hai sviluppato un siero che ti protegge dai danni. I tuoi punti ferita massimi aumentano del tuo livello da alchimista + il tuo modificatore di Costituzione, e aumentano di nuovo di 1 ogni volta che guadagni un livello in questa classe.

optionalfeature.name: Craft Homunculus
entries: Grazie a uno speciale processo alchemico che richiede 8 ore di lavoro, è possibile creare un homunculus. Un homunculus funziona come un famiglio evocato dall'incantesimo {@spell find familiar}, con diverse differenze:

items: Il collegamento telepatico tra voi e il vostro homunculus funziona a qualsiasi distanza, purché voi e il vostro homunculus siate sullo stesso piano di esistenza.
Il vostro homunculus è un costrutto e non può assumere una forma diversa.
Non si può liquidare l'homunculus come si farebbe con un familiare.
L'homunculus può effettuare l'azione Attacco nel suo turno.

entries: Quando l'homunculus muore, il suo corpo rimane e può essere rianimato con un rituale che richiede 1 ora di lavoro e che può essere eseguito nel corso di un riposo breve o lungo. L'homunculus può compiere l'azione {@action Attack} nel suo turno.

optionalfeature.name: Demolition Spree
entries: Quando si effettua l'azione {@action Use an Object} per innescare e lanciare una bomba, si può lanciare un numero di bombe pari al numero di dadi danno della bomba, invece di una sola. Ogni bomba lanciata infligge {@dice 1d10} danni più il proprio modificatore di Intelligenza e non può colpire la stessa creatura o lo stesso spazio. Per queste bombe si devono spendere dadi reagente separatamente e si può applicare una formula di bomba solo a una di esse.

optionalfeature.name: Explosive Missile
entries: Come azione bonus nel proprio turno, si può caricare una delle proprie bombe sulla testa di un dardo della balestra. Invece di infliggere i normali danni, questa saetta infligge danni come se fosse stata innescata e lanciata, ma non ha un raggio d'azione. Solo una bomba alla volta può essere caricata su un bullone e non si può lanciare un bullone esplosivo se si è già lanciata una bomba nel proprio turno.

optionalfeature.name: Fire Brand
entries: Come azione bonus, è possibile mescolare i reagenti della propria bomba e applicare l'intruglio infuocato a un'arma da mischia che si tiene in mano. Fino alla fine del proprio turno, quest'arma da mischia infligge {@dice 1d6} danni da fuoco aggiuntivi quando viene colpita. Questo danno bonus aumenta del {@dice 1d6} al 5° livello ({@dice 2d6}), all'11° livello ({@dice 3d6}) e al 17° livello ({@dice 4d6}).

optionalfeature.name: Fire Eater
entries: Invece di lanciare una bomba, si può compiere l'azione {@action Use an Object} per bere il contenuto di una bomba e sputarlo in un cono di 15 piedi. Ogni creatura all'interno del cono deve effettuare un tiro salvezza di Destrezza o subire danni come se la bomba fosse stata lanciata. Se il tiro salvezza riesce, la creatura subisce la metà dei danni. Quando si usa questa capacità, si subiscono {@dice 1d4} punti di danno da fuoco per ogni dado danno della bomba.

optionalfeature.name: Fire in the Hole
entries: Hai modificato la formula della tua bomba per aumentarne la resa esplosiva. La DC della bomba aumenta di metà del tuo bonus di competenza, arrotondato per difetto.

optionalfeature.name: Fortified Serum
entries: Ogni volta che una creatura recupera punti ferita bevendo una delle vostre pozioni, guadagna resistenza ai danni da percosse, perforazione e taglio da armi non magiche fino alla fine del suo turno successivo.

optionalfeature.name: Grenadier
entries: Quando si innesca e si lancia una bomba, si può usare la propria azione bonus per effettuare un attacco con un'arma che non sia a due mani.

optionalfeature.name: Dynamo Charger
entries: Hai inventato un dispositivo che ricarica rapidamente le dinamo degli incantesimi. Una volta al giorno, al termine di un breve riposo, è possibile recuperare 2 slot di incantesimi esauriti conservati nelle dinamo. È possibile configurare queste dinamo immediatamente.

optionalfeature.name: Hemoreagent
entries: Quando si innesca e si lancia una bomba, si può convertire una quantità del proprio sangue in reagenti. Si possono aggiungere cinque o meno dadi reagente al tiro per i danni della bomba e si subisce {@dice 1d6} danno necrotico per ogni dado reagente aggiunto. Questo danno non può essere evitato o ridotto.

optionalfeature.name: Lazarus Bolt
entries: Avete scoperto una soluzione negromantica radicale: ripristinare la vita con l'elettricità diretta al cuore. Come azione, potete conficcare un fulmine nel torso di una creatura morta nell'ultimo minuto e riportarla in vita con una scossa. La creatura torna in vita con 1 punto ferita. Questa caratteristica non può riportare in vita una creatura priva di cuore, una creatura morta di vecchiaia o una creatura priva di organi vitali.
Una volta utilizzata questa abilità, non è possibile utilizzarla di nuovo fino al termine di un riposo breve o lungo.

optionalfeature.name: Magnified Blast
entries: Grazie a un nuovo design interno per le bombe, è possibile espanderne il raggio di esplosione insieme alla magnitudo. Ogni volta che si aggiungono dadi reagente al danno della bomba, si può anche scegliere di espandere il raggio di esplosione della bomba di una distanza massima di 5 piedi per ogni due dadi reagente spesi.

optionalfeature.name: Ooze Cowboy
entries: Tired of waiting for your oozes to catch up with you, you've modified your formula to make extra fast slimes! All slimes you make have a movement speed of 30 feet, if it were lower. Additionally, you can ride any ooze you make of Medium size or larger as a mount. You and your equipment suffer no ill effect from touching your oozes directly. Lastly, your oozes add your proficiency modifier to their damage rolls and initiative rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Poisoner
entries: Thanks to your research into poisonous compounds, you've learned how to concoct lethal toxins. You gain proficiency with the {@item poisoner's kit|phb}. Additionally, you can craft the following poisons when you brew potions, which use your bomb save DC instead of their normal save DC:

optionalfeature.name: Precision Explosives
entries: You have modified your bombs to have narrow gaps in their explosions, perfect for keeping some creatures safe from the blast. You can choose one creature in the blast radius of a bomb other than the target to automatically succeed its saving throw against the bomb and take no damage from it.

optionalfeature.name: Reactionary Gulp
entries: By keeping your potions organized on a bandolier or in a series of pouches, you can quickly draw them in a moment's notice. Immediately after you take damage from a creature you can see, you can use your reaction to drink a potion.

optionalfeature.name: Recycled Potions
entries: When you brew potions, you can distill those you have already brewed, recovering the reagents stored within. You can convert brewed potions into reagent dice and you can choose to expend those dice to create new potions. You can't gain more than your maximum number of reagent dice using this ability.

optionalfeature.name: Syringe
entries: Using a sophisticated hypodermic needle, you can more quickly administer potions and poisons. As a bonus action, you can inject a potion into yourself or a willing creature within 5 feet of you, granting the benefits of the potion as if it were drank normally. You can inject a potion into an unwilling creature with a successful melee attack.

optionalfeature.name: Tri-Mutation
entries: You've developed a powerful, but fleeting way of blending your mutagens together. When you inject yourself with a mutagen, you can choose to inject a tri-mutagen, which grants you the benefit of all your mutagens at once. This benefit lasts for 1 minute, or until you use your bonus action to inject yourself with a different mutagen. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Blasting Cantrip
entries: Once on each of your turns, when you deal force damage to a creature with a warmage cantrip, you can push the creature up to 10 feet away from you in a straight line.

optionalfeature.name: Bishop's Maneuver
entries: You can take the Disengage action as a bonus action, and when you do so, your walking speed increases by 10 feet until the end of your turn.

optionalfeature.name: Blinding Cantrip
entries: When you use the {@spell light|VSS} cantrip to target an object you are holding, you can direct a flare at a creature you can see within 10 feet of you, which must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC.

optionalfeature.name: Castle
entries: As an action, you can choose a willing Small or Medium creature you can see within 120 feet of you. You both teleport, swapping places.
Once you use this trick, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Chivalrous Presence
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Insight} and {@skill Persuasion} skills, and you have advantage on ability checks you make to interact with nobility. Additionally, other creatures can always discern when you're telling the truth.

optionalfeature.name: Cloak of Feathers
entries: While you are wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, your AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Intelligence modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Commander's Steed
entries: You learn the {@spell find steed|PHB} spell and can cast it without expending a spell slot. Your steed is more resilient than most; its hit point maximum is increased by an amount equal to your warmage level.

optionalfeature.name: Corrosive Cantrip
entries: Once on each of your turns, when you deal acid damage to a creature with a warmage cantrip, you can cause the acid to erode the target's defenses. The next time a creature makes an attack roll against the target before the start of your next turn, roll a d4 and subtract it from the target's Armor Class for this attack.

optionalfeature.name: Directed Momentum
entries: Once on each of your turns, when you score a critical hit with a melee attack or reduce a creature to 0 hit points with one, you can make an unarmed strike against a second target. If the target is within range of your Shock Trooper feature, you can lunge toward it. On a hit, this attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} force damage.

optionalfeature.name: Draining Cantrip
entries: Whenever you deal necrotic or poison damage to a hostile creature with a warmage cantrip, you can siphon some of its life force. You gain temporary hit points equal to half your warmage level, which last for 1 minute.

optionalfeature.name: Encryptogram
entries: Your knowledge of ciphers has improved your magically clandestine communications. When you cast the {@spell cryptogram|VSS} cantrip, its limit is 20 characters, instead of 8, and only the specified recipient can read the message.

optionalfeature.name: Explosive Cantrip
entries: Once on each of your turns, when you deal fire damage to a creature with a warmage cantrip, each creature within 5 feet of the target, except yourself and the target, must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or take half the fire damage dealt to the target.

optionalfeature.name: Extended Range
entries: When you cast a warmage cantrip that has a range of 5 feet or greater, its range is doubled.

optionalfeature.name: Field Medic
entries: You learn the {@spell spare the dying|PHB} cantrip, which doesn't count against your number of cantrips known. Additionally, when you cast {@spell spare the dying|PHB} on a creature that has 0 hit points, the target regains 1 hit point and gains temporary hit points equal to your warmage level, which last for 1 minute. Once a creature regains hit points from this trick, it can't do so again until it finishes a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Flexible Range
entries: Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged spell attack rolls. Additionally, when you cast a warmage cantrip that requires a melee spell attack, its range increases to 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Fold
entries: You have learned to graciously accept defeat using your Deck of Fate. As a reaction when you are hit by an attack, you can play your entire hand to cast the {@spell shield|PHB} spell without expending a spell slot.
Once you use this trick, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Gamble

subclass.name: House of Cards or House of Dice

entries: You are always under the effects of the {@spell cheat|VSS} cantrip.
Additionally, you can reroll an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Infinite Variation
entries: You have become exceptionally skilled at using the {@spell prestidigitation|PHB} cantrip to mimic other spells. When you cast {@spell prestidigitation|PHB}, you can use it to emulate the effects of any other cantrip that doesn't deal damage, even one that is not on the warmage spell list. To do so, you must succeed on a DC 15 Intelligence (Arcana) check, otherwise the spell fails. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for a cantrip cast using this trick, and it counts as a warmage cantrip for you.

optionalfeature.name: Icy Cantrip
entries: Once on each of your turns, when you deal cold damage to a creature with a warmage cantrip, you can numb the target with a frigid blast. The first time the target makes an attack roll before the end of its next turn, it must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the number rolled from the attack roll.

optionalfeature.name: Knight's Aegis
entries: When you cast the {@spell force buckler|VSS} cantrip, you can concentrate on it for up to 1 minute. The spell doesn't end early if you are hit by an attack.

optionalfeature.name: Leading Edge Tactics
entries: You always have a plan when engaging the enemy. Whenever a creature makes an attack against you during the first round of combat, it has disadvantage on the attack roll.

optionalfeature.name: Lieutenant's Demand
entries: You can cast the spell {@spell command|PHB} at will without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Mage Hand Knack
entries: Your skill with the {@spell mage hand|PHB} cantrip allows you to use it as an extension of yourself. When you cast the spell and as a bonus action on your subsequent turns, you can use one of the following effects with the hand:

items: {@italic {@bold Press.}} The hand pushes against a Large or smaller creature within 5 feet of it. Choose a direction away from that creature. Every foot of movement in that direction while the hand is pressing against it costs the creature 1 extra foot of movement. The hand continues to push against the target until the spell ends or you use your bonus action to use a different effect with the hand.

{@italic {@bold Punch.}} The hand strikes one creature or object within 5 feet of it. Make a melee spell attack for the hand using your spell attack bonus. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} force damage.

{@italic {@bold Seize.}} The hand grabs a Tiny creature and attempts to grapple it. The creature must succeed on a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check (its choice) against your spell save DC or be grappled by the hand. The hand continues to grapple the target until the target uses an action to break the grapple on its turn, the spell ends, or you use your bonus action to use a different effect with the hand.

optionalfeature.name: Minor Shadow Illusion
entries: When you create the image of an object in an unoccupied space using the {@spell minor illusion|PHB} cantrip, you can fill it with fibers of shadowstuff, causing it to become partially real. No matter what form the semi-real object takes, it still must be no larger than a 5-foot cube. It has AC 10 and 5 hit points, and it weighs 5 pounds. You can only have one semi-real illusion at a time. While this semi-real object exists, the cantrip requires your concentration.

The illusion can't replicate a creature, but it can deal damage to a creature within its 5-foot cube. If the illusion is of an object that can deal damage, a creature that enters the object's 5-foot cube or begins its turn there must make an Intelligence saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d6} damage of a type appropriate to the illusion. This damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d6}), 11th level ({@damage 3d6}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d6}). This damage can't trigger Warmage Edge or any warmage trick.

optionalfeature.name: Mystical Armor
entries: You can cast the {@spell mage armor|PHB} spell on yourself at will, without using a spell slot or spell components.

optionalfeature.name: Mystical Athlete
entries: When you cast the {@spell quickstep} cantrip, your speed increases by 20 feet instead of 10 feet. When you cast the {@spell springheel} cantrip, your jumping distance increases by 20 feet instead of 10 feet. If you know both of these cantrips, you can cast both of them as part of the same bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Mystical Weaponmaster
entries: Once on each of your turns when you roll a 1 on the d20 for an attack roll with the {@spell force weapon|VSS} or {@spell magic daggers|VSS} cantrips, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

optionalfeature.name: Mystical Vision
entries: You can cast the {@spell detect magic|PHB} spell at will without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Phantom Hookshot
entries: You can cast the {@spell phantom grapnel|VSS} cantrip as a bonus action. If you do so, its range is reduced to 15 feet. Additionally, creatures pulled by {@spell phantom grapnel|VSS} are pulled an additional 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Rapid Fortification
entries: You can cast the {@spell mending|PHB} cantrip as a bonus action, or you can cast it as an action for one of the following effects:

items: You can restore a single nonmagical object, such as a door, cart, or window, to pristine condition if at least half of its parts are present. This object can be no larger than 10 cubic feet, or 1 cubic foot if it exceptionally complex (such as a clock).

You can create simple fortifications, such as sealing a door shut, adding wooden planks to a window, or building a short stone wall (no larger than 10 cubic feet). You must have the materials present to use this ability.

optionalfeature.name: Snake Eyes
entries: If you roll a 1 or 2 on a Die of Fate, you keep the die instead of giving it to the GM.

optionalfeature.name: Severe Cantrip
entries: When a creature rolls a 1 on a saving throw against one of your warmage cantrips, it automatically fails the save and takes twice the number of damage dice dealt by the spell, as if you scored a critical hit. The additional damage only applies to the creature that rolled a 1.

optionalfeature.name: Signature Focus
entries: When you finish a long rest, you can place a unique sigil on a simple weapon, which becomes your signature focus until you use this trick again. This weapon becomes magical, and it can be used as a spellcasting focus for your warmage spells. Your signature focus is bonded to you, and gains a number of special abilities:

items: As a bonus action, you can call your signature focus to your hand, as long as you are on the same plane of existence as it.
You can add your Intelligence modifier, instead of your Strength or Dexterity modifier, to attack rolls using your signature focus.

Your signature focus gains a number of charges equal to your Intelligence modifier (a minimum of 1). When you damage a creature with it or a cantrip cast through it, you can expend 1 charge to deal an extra {@damage 1d8} force damage to that creature. Your focus regains all spent charges after you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Silent Cantrip
entries: Once on each of your turns when you deal thunder damage to a hostile creature with a warmage cantrip, you can create a 15-foot-diameter sphere of magical silence (as per the {@spell silence|PHB} spell), centered on yourself or the creature (your choice), which lasts until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Split Fire
entries: When you cast a warmage cantrip that requires a single spell attack roll, you can select multiple creatures and make a spell attack roll against each. You can target a number of creatures equal to the number of damage dice the cantrip deals, and split your damage dice up amongst your targets, to a minimum of 1 die of damage per target. Each attack must target a different creature.

For example, fire bolt deals 3d10 damage. You can choose to target three creatures and deal 1d10 damage to each creature, or you can target two creatures, dealing 1d10 damage to one creature and 2d10 damage to the other creature, or you can target one creature for 3d10 damage.

optionalfeature.name: Static Cantrip
entries: Whenever you deal lightning damage to a hostile creature with a warmage cantrip, you can sap part of the energy into a charge, which clings to your body until the start of your next turn. While charged, you can use your reaction when you take damage from a creature you can see within 5 feet of you to deal lightning damage equal to half your warmage level to the creature.

optionalfeature.name: Unerring Strike
entries: When you cast the {@spell true strike|PHB} cantrip, you can concentrate on it for a number of rounds equal to your Intelligence modifier. You gain advantage on the first attack roll you make against the target on each of your turns while maintaining concentration on {@spell true strike|PHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Abate
entries: As an action, choose one creature you can see within 60 feet of you to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature can't take reactions until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Apathy
entries: As an action, choose one creature you can see within 60 feet of you to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, until the end of your next turn, the creature becomes indifferent toward one creature of your choice that it is hostile towards. This indifference ends if the target is attacked or harmed by the creature to which it is indifferent. When the hex ends, the creature becomes hostile again, unless the GM rules otherwise.

optionalfeature.name: Beckon Familiar
entries: You can cast the {@spell find familiar} spell as an action without expending a spell slot or material components. Once you cast this spell in this way, you can't do so again for 1 minute.
You must have the Familiar feature to choose this hex.

optionalfeature.name: Bleeding
entries: As an action, choose one creature you can see within 60 feet of you to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, each time this creature takes damage, it loses an additional {@dice 1d4} hit points. This effect lasts until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Charm
entries: As an action, choose one creature you can see within 60 feet to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition charmed} by you until the end of your next turn. When the hex ends, the creature knows it was charmed by you.

optionalfeature.name: Dire Familiar
entries: As an action, you can bolster your summoned familiar. For 1 minute, your familiar's current and maximum hit points are increased by an amount equal to twice your witch level, and it gains a bonus to its damage rolls equal to your Charisma modifier.
You can cast other hexes while this hex is in effect. Once you cast this hex, you can't cast it again until your familiar is dismissed, or until its duration expires.
You must have the Familiar feature to choose this hex.

optionalfeature.name: Disorient
entries: As an action, choose one creature you can see within 60 feet of you to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, whenever the target makes an attack roll before the end of your next turn, it must roll a {@dice d6} and subtract the number rolled from the attack roll.

optionalfeature.name: Doomward
entries: As an action, choose one friendly creature other than yourself that you can see within 60 feet of you. If the creature drops to 0 hit points before the end of your next turn and doesn't die outright, it drops to 1 hit point instead. This hex then ends and can't be used to target the same creature again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Duplicity
entries: As an action, you can create an illusory duplicate of yourself, composed of shadowstuff, to confuse your enemies. When a creature attacks you, roll any die. On an odd number, the attack strikes the duplicate and misses, regardless of its roll, and the hex ends. On an even number, the attack targets you as normal. This effect lasts until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Evil Eye
entries: As an action, choose one creature you can see within 60 feet of you that can see you to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened} of you until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Fortune
entries: As an action, choose one friendly creature other than yourself that you can see within 60 feet of you. The creature has advantage on saving throws until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Go Unseen
entries: As an action, you and your familiar become {@condition invisible} (as per the {@spell invisibility} spell). The effect ends at the end of your next turn, or if you or your familiar attack or cast a spell.
Once you cast this hex, you can't cast it again for 1 minute.

optionalfeature.name: Hobble
entries: As an action, choose one creature you can see within 60 feet of you to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's speed is reduced to 10 feet until the end of your next turn. If the creature is flying, it falls, unless it has the ability to hover or it is being held aloft by magic.

optionalfeature.name: Knowing
entries: As an action, you open your third eye and become intuitively aware of your surroundings. You have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks until the end of your next turn. Additionally, choose one of the following pieces of information:

items: If a creature can speak a language
If a creature is at or below half its hit point maximum
What a creature's lowest ability score is

entries: You learn that piece of information for each creature within 30 feet of you. You can only learn one of these things about a creature, even if you cast this hex more than once.

optionalfeature.name: Mire
entries: As an action, you can transform the ground in a 30- foot radius centered on the point where you cast this hex into murky swamp, which is difficult terrain. You and your familiar can move without penalty in this area. This effect lasts until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Misfortune
entries: As an action, choose one creature you can see within 60 feet of you. Until the end of your next turn, whenever this creature rolls a 20 on a {@dice d20} roll, the roll instead becomes a 1.

optionalfeature.name: Obfuscate
entries: As an action, you create a 20-foot-radius sphere of fog centered on yourself. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. This effect lasts until the end of your next turn or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.

optionalfeature.name: Peacebond
entries: As an action, you can lock weapons to their owners. The weapons and ammunition of each creature within 30 feet of you become locked in their sheaths, quivers, or holsters until the end of your next turn. During this time, a creature can use its action to free its weapon by succeeding on a Strength check against your spell save DC.

optionalfeature.name: Pox
entries: As an action, choose one creature you can see within 5 feet of you to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition poisoned} until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Ruin
entries: As an action, choose one creature you can see within 60 feet of you to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's Armor Class decreases by 3, to a minimum of 10, until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Scurry
entries: As an action, a nonmagical object you choose within 30 feet of you sprouts legs and runs away. You can't target an object that weighs more than 10 pounds, nor can you target one that is being worn as clothing or armor; however, you can target certain objects that are being carried, as long as they aren't affixed entirely around a creature's body or being held in a hand. For example, you can't target a creature's helmet or a sword it is wielding, but you can target a drawstring pouch it is wearing or a dagger that is sheathed at its side.

The object animates, wriggles free of its owner (if it has one), sprouts two legs, and moves 20 feet in a direction you choose. At the start of your turn, you can choose which direction the object moves. The object has an AC of 10, if its AC wasn't already higher, and remains animated until the end of your next turn, or until it is picked up.

optionalfeature.name: Shriek
entries: As a bonus action, you can release a thunderous, blood-curdling screech. Each Large or smaller creature you choose within 5 feet of you is pushed 5 feet away from you.

optionalfeature.name: Slumber
entries: As an action, choose one creature you can see within 60 feet of you to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target falls {@condition unconscious} until it takes damage, or until the end of your next turn. Undead, creatures that are immune to being {@condition charmed}, and creatures whose current hit points are greater than five times your witch level are immune to this effect.

optionalfeature.name: Slur
entries: As an action, choose one creature you can see within 60 feet of you to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature can't speak coherently until the end of your next turn. If the creature attempts to cast a spell that requires a verbal component, it must roll a {@dice d20}. On an odd roll, the casting fails.

optionalfeature.name: Tremors
entries: As an action, you can create a miniature earthquake. Each creature on the ground within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

optionalfeature.name: Ward
entries: As an action, choose one creature you can see other than yourself within 60 feet of you. Each time the creature takes damage before the end of your next turn, the damage it takes is reduced by 3.

optionalfeature.name: Cauldron
entries: You can brew potions in a bubbling cauldron using raw components scavenged from nature. To this end, you have a pool of alchemy points equal to half your witch level, rounded down. You regain all expended alchemy points when you finish a long rest.

You can spend 10 minutes and expend any number of alchemy points to brew potions. These potions retain potency for 24 hours, after which they become inert. If a potion calls requires a saving throw, it uses your spell save DC.
The potions available for you to brew are given on the Cauldron Potions table below.

optionalfeature.name: Coven
entries: You can induct others into your insidious coven. By performing a special ritual over the course of 8 hours, which can be done during a long rest, you can intermingle your cursed magic with a willing creature that has the Spellcasting or Pact Magic feature. This creature enters into your coven. You can have up to two creatures other than yourself in your coven at a time.

While two or more members of your coven are within 30 feet of one another, they gain the ability to cast additional spells, as shown on the Coven Spellcasting table. Additionally, members of your coven gain access to a shared pool of 5 spell slots—one of each level, from 1st to 5th level—which they can use to cast spells as normal. Expended spell slots are regained when all members of the coven finish a long rest.

Coven members use their own spellcasting ability to determine spell attack bonuses and spell save DCs. A coven member can't cast spells of a level for which it doesn't personally have spell slots, even if using a higher level shared spell slot. A shared spell slot can be used, for instance, to cast a lower level spell at higher levels, but it can't be used to cast a spell normally too high-level for a spellcaster.

optionalfeature.name: Dual Hex
entries: When you cast a hex that targets one creature other than yourself, you can target two creatures instead. While both targets are under the effect of your hex, you gain the benefits of your Insidious Spell feature against each of them.

optionalfeature.name: Forceful Personality
entries: Your Charisma score increases by 2, and your maximum for this score increases to 22.

optionalfeature.name: Hybrid
entries: As a bonus action, if your familiar is within 5 feet of you, you can meld with it, transforming into a magical hybrid. For the next minute, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain temporary hit points equal to your familiar's hit points.
Your Armor Class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Charisma modifier, as long as you aren't wielding a shield.

You gain two natural melee weapons, corresponding to your familiar's attacks. You are proficient with these weapons, and use Charisma for their attack and damage rolls. On a hit, these natural weapons deal {@dice 1d10} bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage (your choice).
You can attack twice, instead of once, when you take the Attack action on your turn. You ignore this benefit if you already have a feature, like Extra Attack, that gives you extra attacks.
You can use any action or movement your familiar possesses.

entries: This transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you dismiss it on your turn (no action required). When it ends, your familiar is dismissed, and you can't summon it again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Poison Apple
entries: As an action, you can produce a magical apple out of thin air. This apple can possess whatever appearance you wish, be that a ruby red coloration, a golden skin, or the appearance of crystal. On your turn, you can use your action to eat the apple, granting you the following benefits:

items: You regain hit points equal to twice your witch level + your Charisma modifier.
You regain an expended spell slot of 5th level or lower.
You can end one of the following conditions affecting you: {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition paralyzed} (if the apple is fed to you as an action), or {@condition poisoned}.

entries: However, the apple is suffused with your insidious magic. If a creature other than yourself eats the apple, it doesn't gain any benefits and instead must make a Wisdom saving throw with disadvantage. On a failed save, the creature becomes {@condition poisoned} for up to 24 hours. For each hour the creature is {@condition poisoned}, it loses {@dice 4d8} hit points. This loss can't be reduced or avoided. If this reduction causes the creature to drop to 0 hit points, the creature instead drops to 1 hit point and falls into a catatonic sleep, remaining {@condition unconscious} for up to 7 days. A {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic can awaken this creature early.
The apple shrivels and becomes nonmagical if it isn't eaten within 24 hours. Once you produce a magical apple, you can't produce another one until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Possession
entries: As an action, your body becomes immaterial, and your spirit dives into a Large or smaller creature you can see within 10 feet of you in an attempt to possess it. This target must make a Charisma saving throw. A creature with a challenge rating greater than your witch level automatically succeeds on this save. On a failed save, you disappear and the target becomes incapacitated and possessed; you gain control of its body but don't deprive the target of its awareness. While possessing the creature, you can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect. You maintain your Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma and your alignment, but otherwise use the creature's statistics. You don't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.

For the purposes of spells and effects which can end possession, such as the spell {@spell dispel evil and good}, you are treated as an undead spirit and can be banished from the target, returning to your own body, which rematerializes within 5 feet of the target.
This possession lasts for 1 hour, or until the body drops to 0 hit points or you are forced out by a spell or other magical effect that ends possession.
Once you use this grand hex, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: War Hex
entries: When you cast a hex that targets a single creature, you can use your bonus action to cast a cantrip targeting the same creature.

optionalfeature.name: Witch's Broom
entries: You can use your action to enchant a mundane object—such as a broom, cauldron, or rug—to fly for you. You gain a flying speed of 60 feet while holding this item, as long as you aren't wearing medium or heavy armor, or wielding a shield. You can only enchant one object using this ability at a time, and if you target another object using it, the enchantment on the previous object ends.

optionalfeature.name: Witch's Hut
entries: You can perform a 24-hour ritual to enchant a structure that can fit within a 15-foot cube, animating it as a Huge object, as per the {@spell animate objects} spell. The structure rises up on a pair of magical legs and follows your commands.

The entrance to the structure is linked to an extradimensional dwelling, as per the {@spell mordenkainen's magnificent mansion} spell. You can command the structure from inside this dwelling. If the structure is destroyed, the extradimensional dwelling is unharmed, but any creatures inside it are expelled into the unoccupied spaces nearest to the entrance.
As an action, you can teleport the structure to an unoccupied space you can see within 60 feet of you. Once you teleport the structure, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.
You can repeat the 24-hour ritual to end the enchantment on your previous structure and enchant a new one.

optionalfeature.name: Akimbo
entries: When you engage in two-weapon fighting with firearms, you don't take a penalty to the damage of the second attack.

optionalfeature.name: Bullseye
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to ranged attack rolls you make with firearms. The weapon must have the Sighted property or have a normal range of 80 feet or longer to gain this benefit. This benefit doesn't stack with the Archery fighting style.

optionalfeature.name: Duelist
entries: While you are wielding a firearm in one hand and nothing in the other, if you make a ranged weapon attack and exceed the target's AC by 5 or more, you deal one extra die of weapon damage. You can only use this ability once per round.

optionalfeature.name: Shotgunner
entries: When you hit with a ranged weapon attack using a firearm that has the Scatter property, you can reroll the lowest damage die, and you must use the new roll, even if the new roll is worse than the original.

optionalfeature.name: Bite The Bullet
entries: As a bonus action on your turn, you can expend one risk die to gain temporary hit points equal the number rolled on the die + your Constitution modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Covering Fire
entries: When you hit a creature with a ranged weapon attack, you can expend one risk die as a bonus action to cow the creature. Roll the risk die and subtract it from the next attack roll the creature makes before the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Dodge Roll
entries: You can expend one risk die as a bonus action to move up to 15 feet and reload any firearm you are holding. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks, ignores difficult terrain, and allows you to move through a hostile creature's space, as long as you don't end your movement there.

optionalfeature.name: Limb Shot
entries: When you hit a creature with a ranged weapon attack, you can expend one risk die as a bonus action and aim for one of its limbs, attempting to force it to drop one item of your choice that it's holding. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it drops the object you choose. The object lands at its feet.

optionalfeature.name: Skin of Your Teeth
entries: When an attacker you can see makes an attack roll against you, you can expend a risk die as a reaction to dodge out of harm's way at the last second. You add the risk die to your AC against this attack, potentially causing it to miss.

optionalfeature.name: Steady Aim
entries: On your turn, you can use a bonus action and expend one risk die to double the normal and maximum range for the next ranged weapon attack you make.

optionalfeature.name: Aerodynamic
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork weapon with the Thrown property
This weapon's normal range increases by 40 feet and its long range increases accordingly.

optionalfeature.name: Automatic
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork ranged weapon with the Reload property
This weapon gains the Automatic property and its damage decreases by one step. The weapon's normal range decreases by 20 feet and its long range decreases accordingly.

{@bold Automatic.} When you make an attack with this weapon on your turn, you can choose to make two attacks instead. These attacks are always made with disadvantage, regardless of circumstance. These attacks use twice the normal amount of ammunition.

optionalfeature.name: Balanced
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork exotic weapon with the Heavy property
Small creatures wielding this weapon don't have disadvantage on attack rolls with it as a result of its Heavy property.

optionalfeature.name: Concealable
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork weapon with the Light property
This weapon gains the Concealable property.
{@bold Concealable.} While stowed, you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to conceal this weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Elegant
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork exotic melee weapon with the Light property or a masterwork exotic ranged weapon with the Light and Thrown properties
This weapon gains the Elegant property and its damage die increases by one step.
{@b Elegant.} This weapon requires exceptional skill to use. You must have a Dexterity score of 16 or higher to wield an elegant weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Exotic
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork martial weapon
This weapon becomes an exotic weapon and its damage die increases by one step.
No class, other than the craftsman, gains proficiency with exotic weapons.

optionalfeature.name: Extended Magazine
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork martial or exotic weapon with the Reload property
The Reload capacity of this weapon is doubled.

optionalfeature.name: Finesse
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork melee weapon that doesn't have the Two-Handed property or a masterwork ranged weapon that has the Thrown property
This weapon gains the Finesse property.

optionalfeature.name: Firearm
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork ranged weapon with the Loading or Reload property that doesn't have the Tension property
This weapon becomes a firearm and gains the Firearm property. Its damage die increases by four steps and moves to two damage dice, if possible.
{@b Firearm.} You don't add your ability modifier to this weapon's damage rolls. Firearm ammunition can't be recovered once used.

optionalfeature.name: Fist
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork melee weapon with the Light property
This weapon gains the Fist property.
{@b Fist.} Attacks made with this weapon are treated as unarmed strikes.

optionalfeature.name: Foregrip
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork ranged weapon with the Ammunition property that doesn't have the Two- Handed property
This weapon gains the Foregrip property.
{@b Forgegrip.} This weapon can be used with one or two hands. If used in two hands, its normal range increases by 50 feet and its long range increases accordingly.

optionalfeature.name: Heavy
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork martial or exotic weapon with the Two-Handed property that doesn't have the Double property
This weapon gains the Heavy property. If it is a melee weapon, its damage die increases by one step.
If it is ranged, its normal range increases by 20 feet and its long range increases accordingly.

optionalfeature.name: Light
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork weapon that doesn't have the Two-Handed or Versatile properties
This weapon gains the Light property, and its damage die decreases by one step.

optionalfeature.name: Loading
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork ranged weapon with the Ammunition property that doesn't have the Reload property
This weapon gains the Loading property, and its damage die increases by one step.

optionalfeature.name: Martial
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork simple weapon
This weapon becomes a martial weapon, and its damage die increases by one step.

optionalfeature.name: Parrying
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork exotic melee weapon with the Finesse or Light property
This weapon gains the Parrying property and its damage die decreases by one step.
{@b Parrying.} While wielding this weapon and not wielding a shield, you gain a +1 bonus to your AC against melee attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Reach
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork martial or exotic melee weapon with the Finesse or Two-Handed property
This weapon gains the Reach property, and its damage die decreases by one step.

optionalfeature.name: Reload
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork ranged weapon with the Ammunition property that doesn't have the Loading property

This weapon gains the Reload (5) property. If you apply the Reload property to a martial or exotic weapon with the Mounted property, you can choose to give it the Reload (1, 2 actions) property, and increase its damage by three steps.

{@b Reload.} This weapon can be used to make a number of attacks before it must be reloaded. If you are proficient with the weapon, reloading it takes a bonus action; otherwise, reloading it takes an action. Some weapons require an action or longer to reload, even if you have proficiency, which is specified in the Reload property. If reloading a weapon requires longer than one action, the weapon can't be used to make attacks until reloading is finished.

optionalfeature.name: Returning
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork martial or exotic weapon with the Light and Thrown properties
This weapon gains the Returning property.
{@b Returning.} After being thrown, this weapon returns to your hand at the end of your turn.

optionalfeature.name: Scatter
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork ranged weapon with the Ammunition and Two-Handed properties that doesn't have the Sighted property

This weapon gains the Scatter property and its damage die decreases by one step. The weapon's damage die increases by two steps when an attack with it is made against a target within half of its normal range.
The weapon's long range becomes three times the weapon's normal range. The weapon's normal range decreases by 70 feet and its long range decreases accordingly.
{@b Scatter.} If you make an attack against a target that is within half this weapon's normal range, you deal the damage value listed in parentheses instead of the weapon's normal damage dice.

optionalfeature.name: Sighted
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork martial or exotic ranged weapon with the Ammunition property that doesn't have the Scatter property
This weapon gains the Sighted property. Additionally, its normal range increases by 50 feet and its long range increases accordingly.
{@b Sighted.} This weapon has disadvantage on attack rolls made against targets within 20 feet of you.

optionalfeature.name: Superheavy
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork exotic melee weapon with the Heavy property
This weapon gains the Superheavy property and its damage die increases by one step.
{@b Superheavy.} This weapon is unusually large for its type. You must have a Strength score of 16 or higher to wield a superheavy weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Switch
entries: {@bold Components:} Two masterwork exotic weapons

This weapon gains the Switch property and its damage die decreases by one step. You can integrate two weapons together with the Switch property, forming a single unit in which each weapon is one of the unit's two forms. You can choose to use two identical weapons with the Light property for one of the weapon's forms.
{@b Switch.} This weapon has two forms. You can swap between which weapon is being used at any time, even between attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Thrown
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork melee weapon that doesn't have the Two-Handed property
This weapon gains the Thrown property with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Trip
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork martial or exotic melee weapon
This weapon gains the Trip property.
{@b Trip.} You can make a shove attempt against any creature within this weapon's reach. Furthermore, you have advantage on ability checks you make to shove a creature using this weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Two-Handed
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork weapon that doesn't have the Finesse, Foregrip, Light, Thrown, or Versatile properties

This weapon gains the Two-Handed property and its damage die increases by one step. Additionally, if it is a ranged weapon, its normal range increases by 50 feet and its long range increases accordingly.

optionalfeature.name: Versatile
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork melee weapon that doesn't have the Light or Two-Handed properties
This weapon gains the Versatile property. While being wielded in two hands, its damage die increases by one step.

optionalfeature.name: Counterweighted
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork exotic weapon with the Two-Handed property
You can wield this weapon in one hand, as long as you don't have a weapon in your other hand.

optionalfeature.name: Double
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork exotic melee weapon that doesn't have the Heavy property
This weapon gains the Double property and its damage die decreases by one step.

{@b Double.} This weapon has two damage-dealing ends. When you use the Attack action and make an attack with this weapon, you can use your bonus action to make an additional attack with it; you don't add your ability modifier to the damage roll of this additional attack.

optionalfeature.name: Explosive
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork martial or exotic ranged weapon
This weapon gains the Explosive property and its damage die decreases by one step. If this weapon dealt bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, its deals fire damage instead.

{@b Explosive.} When this weapon's projectile hits a target, it explodes in a 15-foot diameter sphere. The projectile can target an unoccupied space within its range. Each creature other than the target within the blast radius (for a Medium or smaller target, each creature within 5 feet of it) must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw, taking half the damage rolled on a failed save or no damage on a successful one.

optionalfeature.name: Heat
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork martial or exotic ranged weapon with the Firearm property
This weapon gains the Heat property and its damage die increases by one step.

{@b Heat.} This weapon gains a heat point whenever an attack is made with it and loses one heat point whenever you begin your turn. If the weapon gains 3 heat points, it overheats and loses all heat points. An overheated weapon can't be used to make an attack again until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Magical
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork exotic weapon
This weapon becomes magical and gains a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. This benefit stacks if you apply the Magical property at different levels.

optionalfeature.name: Massive
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork exotic melee weapon with the Superheavy property
This weapon gains the Massive property and its damage die increases by two steps.

{@b Massive.} You can only make an attack with this weapon when you take the Attack action, and only as the first attack you make on your turn. Once you make an attack with this weapon, you can't make any attacks until the start of your next turn. If you would be able to attack more than once when you take the Attack action on your turn, you deal an extra two dice of damage for each attack you forgo when using this weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Mounted
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork martial or exotic ranged weapon with the Heavy property
This weapon gains the Mounted property and its damage die increases by two steps.

{@b Mounted} This weapon is normally used while attached to a tripod, vehicle, or other bracing mount. You can mount or unmount this weapon as an action. While it is mounted, it can't be moved. It can only be used to make an attack while unmounted if held by a Medium or larger creature with a Strength score of at least 15.

optionalfeature.name: Precision
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork exotic melee weapon with the Elegant property
This weapon gains the Precision property.
{@b Precision.} Once per turn, you can deal an extra {@dice 1d6} damage to one creature you hit with this weapon if you have advantage on the attack roll.

optionalfeature.name: Rocket
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork exotic weapon
This weapon gains the Rocket property and its damage die decreases by one step.

{@b Rocket.} This weapon has a small propulsive engine attached to it or its projectiles. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can deal an extra {@dice 1d4} damage to the target.

optionalfeature.name: Sniper
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork exotic ranged weapon with the Ammunition property that doesn't have the Scatter property
This weapon's long range becomes eight times the weapon's normal range.

optionalfeature.name: Tension
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork exotic ranged weapon that doesn't have the Firearm property
This weapon gains the Tension property.

{@b Tension.} When making a ranged weapon attack with a tension weapon, you use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Twin Shot
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork exotic ranged weapon
This weapon gains the Twinshot property.

{@b Twinshot.} Once on each of your turns when you make an attack with this weapon, you can make another attack with it against a different creature that is within 5 feet of the original target and within range of this weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Adamantine
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork exotic melee weapon with the Heavy or Versatile property
This weapon's damage die increases by two steps, and it deals double damage to objects and structures.

optionalfeature.name: Blessed
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork exotic weapon
This weapon deals an extra {@dice 1d4} radiant damage on a hit. This extra damage increases to {@dice 1d10} radiant damage if the target is a fiend or undead.

optionalfeature.name: Earthshatter
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork exotic weapon with the Massive property

This weapon's damage die increases by two steps. On a hit with this weapon, the target must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is knocked {@condition prone} or pushed 10 feet away from you (your choice).

optionalfeature.name: Elemental
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork exotic weapon
When you apply this property, choose acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage. This weapon deals an extra {@dice 1d6} damage of the chosen type on a hit.

optionalfeature.name: Keen
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork exotic melee weapon with the Finesse or Versatile property
This weapon scores a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

optionalfeature.name: Magical
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork exotic weapon
This weapon becomes magical and gains a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. This benefit stacks if you apply the Magical property at different levels.

optionalfeature.name: Mithral
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork exotic melee weapon with the Finesse property
This weapon's damage die increases by two steps, and its weight is halved.

optionalfeature.name: Serrated
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork exotic weapon that deals slashing damage
When a creature takes damage from serrated weapons twice or more in a single turn, it takes an extra {@dice 1d8} slashing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Slaying
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork exotic weapon
When you apply this property, choose one creature type other than humanoids. This weapon deals an extra {@dice 1d12} damage to creatures of the chosen type.

optionalfeature.name: Vampiric
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork exotic weapon
This weapon deals an extra {@dice 1d4} necrotic damage on a hit. When you hit a hostile creature with this weapon, you regain hit points equal to the extra necrotic damage dealt by this property.

optionalfeature.name: Venom
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork exotic weapon
This weapon deals an extra {@dice 1d8} poison damage on a hit.

optionalfeature.name: Crushing
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork exotic weapon that deals bludgeoning damage

When you hit a creature that has natural armor or is wearing armor, the target takes a cumulative −1 penalty to the AC its armor offers. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 in this way is destroyed. A creature can repair its armor or heal the damage dealt to its natural armor over the course of a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Deadly
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork exotic ranged weapon with the Firearm property
When you make an attack with this weapon as part of an action, you can add your ability modifier to its attack and damage rolls, instead of just to its attack rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Magical
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork exotic weapon
This weapon becomes magical and gains a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. This benefit stacks if you apply the Magical property at different levels.

optionalfeature.name: Penetrating
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork exotic weapon with the Ammunition or Thrown property that deals piercing damage

This weapon pierces through its targets. When you make a ranged attack with this weapon and do not have disadvantage, you can target all creatures in a straight line within this weapon's normal range. You don't make an attack roll for this attack. Instead, each creature in the line must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take damage as if it were hit by the weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Seeking
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork exotic ranged weapon

When you make an attack roll that doesn't have disadvantage with this weapon and miss, you instead hit the target and deal 5 damage of the weapon's type. This damage can't be increased in any way, and no other effects can be applied to the hit.

optionalfeature.name: Threatening
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork exotic melee weapon
When a creature provokes an opportunity attack from you, you can use this weapon to make an opportunity attack against it without using your reaction.

optionalfeature.name: Vorpal
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork exotic weapon that deals slashing damage

When you make an attack against a creature with this weapon and score a critical hit, that target takes an extra {@dice 4d8} slashing damage. Then roll another {@dice d20}. If you roll a 20 on the second roll, you cut off one of the creature's heads. The creature dies if it can't survive without the lost head. A creature is immune to this effect if it is immune to slashing damage, doesn't have or need a head, has legendary actions, or the GM decides that the creature is too big for its head to be cut off with this weapon. Such a creature instead takes an extra 6d8 slashing damage from the hit.

optionalfeature.name: Whirlwind
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork exotic melee weapon with the Elegant property

When you engage in two-weapon fighting using two weapons with this property, you can make a bonus attack against any number of creatures within 5 feet of you, with a separate attack roll against each target. You can't move between these bonus attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Cleated
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork suit of medium or heavy armor
While wearing this armor, when you would be moved by an effect against your will, reduce that movement by 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Climbing
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork suit of exotic light armor
This armor is outfitted with integrated climbing gear. While wearing this armor, as long as you have one hand free, you gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

optionalfeature.name: Comfortable
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork suit of armor
You can sleep in this suit of armor with no ill effect.

optionalfeature.name: Environmental
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork suit of armor
While wearing this suit of armor, you can tolerate temperatures as cold as −100 degrees Fahrenheit or as warm as 300 degrees Fahrenheit.

optionalfeature.name: Exotic
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork suit of armor that isn't exotic
This armor becomes exotic armor, and you have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing it.
No class, other than the craftsman, gains proficiency with exotic armor.

optionalfeature.name: Integrated
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork suit of exotic armor

You can integrate a weapon directly into your armor, or you can integrate two weapons (one into each arm) if neither has the Two-Handed property. When you draw an integrated weapon, it snaps to your hand and you can't be disarmed of it. When you stow it, it retracts back into your armor. You can switch which weapons are integrated over the course of a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Quick-Change
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork suit of armor
You can don or doff this suit of armor as an action.

optionalfeature.name: Retractable
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork suit of exotic medium or heavy armor
One of the gauntlets on this suit of armor has a retractable shield set into it. While wearing this armor, you can don or doff this shield as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Scaled
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork suit of exotic light armor

This armor is covered in heavy, hardened scales. The AC provided by this armor increases by 3. However, you only add your Dexterity modifier to a maximum of +2 when determining your Armor Class while wearing it.

optionalfeature.name: Spiked
entries: {@bold Components:} Masterwork suit of heavy armor
